critique: This document is an executive order designating the Asian Development Bank as a public international organization, entitling it to certain privileges, exemptions, and immunities. It also amends a previous executive order to include the Asian Development Bank within the purview of certain councils and secretaries. There is no direct impact on immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The impact on executive power is neutral, as it simply implements existing legislation. The order does not obviously favor state or federal primacy. The economic regulation aspect is also neutral, as it does not directly regulate the economy but rather facilitates international financial cooperation. The ideological tilt is also neutral, as the order itself does not promote any particular ideology.
